content:
## Section 1 [0:00]

okay this is part four of the if i could go back and tell myself what i know now series this is a hypothetical conversation with my younger self all right so you're looking at all your books and such michael and you're preparing your way to get to financial freedom and while you're practicing the question is going to be is when do you leave demo trading or at the time when we first started it was paper trading so when am i ready for live funds it begins with proof of concept proof of concept you had to show minimum of six months consistency managed to keep risk below three percent

## Section 2 [0:47]

maximum unemotionally weathered strings of losses so when to leave demo first and foremost you have to have proof of concept now you're going to be doing a lot of things you mean buying a lot of books and i wish i could tell you to save all that money because you're going to have over 2 000 books and less than a dozen of them were really worth the time reading a lot of it's going to be regurgitated things so you want to focus on the following things if you do this michael you're going to be able to fast track your way to get through a lot of the hardships that you're that you will unknowingly enter yourself into

## Section 3 [1:34]

and chase and pursue things that are going to lead to more loss and confusion the first thing you'll be focusing on is seasonal tendencies you want to ignore the things that jake bernstein talks about the more research group that puts out seasonal tendencies this person has the best seasonal tendencies mrci.com is the website you're going to find that if you stick to that gentleman's seasonal tendencies they're going to serve you exceptionally well quarterly shifts you'll be looking for moves that move every three to four months now the markets always have some specific

## Section 4 [2:26]

gyration but focusing primarily on the major moves that should transpire over the next three to four months if you focus there you're gonna find a lot of these mega trades monthly bias try to formulate all of the things that you're doing every single day to get in sync with the monthly bias what is the monthly bias likely to do is it likely to trade higher is it likely to trade lower focusing within that particular bias within a specific quarterly shift with any specific seasonal tendency is going to give you the highest odds probability of success than anything you're going to read in any of the books

## Section 5 [3:12]

that you buy so if i could grab you and shake you by the lapels michael this is exactly what i would stress to you because everything that you're doing prior to identifying this is creating the problem all the frustrations you're feeling all that i want to know where it's going next this is the three things that helps figure that out for you but it's going to be years before you discern that but if i could convince you right now this is what i would tell you to do focus on these top three things once you have that determined then you can focus on

## Section 6 [3:53]

a weekly profile now if it's bullish then you're expecting to have a weekly profile that's bullish at the time this recording you're world renowned for knowing and teaching how the weekly bias in weekly range is typically formed with the higher low formed generally by tuesday's london open if not by wednesday so if you can focus on that seasonal tendency that's bullish or bearish and you're looking for that quarterly shift that's in align with that seasonal tendency and you have factored into what the monthly bias should be in concert with those two previous ideas

## Section 7 [4:39]

your weekly profile should be in alignment as well so you're not trying to go against the underlying momentum you're trying to get in sync with the institutional order flow once you identify the seasonal tendency and you're focusing on a quarterly shift or a price swing that should transpire over the next three to four months and your monthly bias is determined to be bullish or bearish relative to those seasonal tendencies in the next quarterly shift and you're working with any weekly profile that's bullish or bearish relative to the idea of that monthly bias and quarterly shift and seasonal tenancy the daily template that means what type

## Section 8 [5:19]

of day are we going to have did we just come off of a big range day or a series of big range days because we're probably going to contract and go into small ranges but if we do go into a small range it's going to be a short term event then it should lead to a large expansion in the direction of the monthly bias in the expectation of the quarterly shift that you're looking for and within alignment of the seasonal tendency the daily template is basically your power 3 concept where it's the open high low and close formation of the daily bar you're looking for accumulation manipulation and distribution you want to spend a lot of time studying

## Section 9 [6:02]

time of day london open has specific characteristics that generally make the higher low of the day not all the time but most of the time new york is a continuation of whatever has transpired in london unless you've reached a higher time frame level or key level that may introduce a new york session market reversal profile london close is typically the opposite end of the daily range or will be opposing the higher low formed in london open focusing on a time of day within all these specific studies are going to put you in the highest order of probability doesn't mean you're going to not take

## Section 10 [6:47]

losses you will but sticking to this in this protocol is going to lead to the longest stretch of consistency and continuity in your trading than you're ever going to find doing anything else minimum six months consistency now i understand you're excited and you see there's a lot of things ahead of you michael and you've made that plan of retiring at 40 and news flash you get there but try not to rush profits there's going to be a transition you don't know when it's going to occur but it is when you start trading the bond market the bond market starts serving you very

## Section 11 [7:37]

well and then you discover that you can do far more per week than you could with just one lot by using more money management and the enticement is going to be get there quicker get there quicker and you discover the power of compound interest but you don't at that time understand the depths that it can take you down with it's very powerful but it's a double-edged sword so if i could change your mind about something speaking to you now you should do your best to try not to be profitable or rush profits and what do i mean by that taking more trades than necessary in other

## Section 12 [8:28]

words your trade frequency michael when you first start is going to be horrendous there's going to be days where you actually have taken 30 entries and none of them are profitable because you're going back and forth back and forth thinking you're going to get the right direction right and it's not going to work out for you this is the reason why you have to work with the previous information where you work from a macro perspective down if you do that you will also be more controlled over your decision making and you won't be in a rush to make profits rushing to profit is the surest fastest way

## Section 13 [9:06]

to lose money it doesn't feel like it especially when you're buying all these books because all these books are sugar coding everything they're over simplifying everything and giving you a false sense of security because of these indicators and the indicators are not the secret those indicators are just the red herring and the gimmick that that book's using to sell keep the monthly return as the focus now you're going to be trading starting with commodities and you're focusing on the dollar amount how much can i make today how much money can i make this week and as soon as you take that first loss for the month this is when you go

## Section 14 [9:48]

into a tailspin because you're in a hurry to get that back you don't like taking losses and i want you to understand something 27 years from now you're going to be able to look back and count up an enormous amount of money that if you collectively add it all up all of your losses are enormous and there is nothing wrong with that because every trader loses but you got to keep the focus on the monthly return it doesn't make a difference if you have three losing trading days out of the week or you had no winning positive days for the week but you come out ahead on the monthly if your monthly return is consistently higher than one percent you're doing

## Section 15 [10:35]

exceptionally well it doesn't feel like it it doesn't sound like it you think that everyone that's super elite is doing 500 per month because that's the impression that these books that you're buying and wasting money on michael are giving you they don't do that they aren't making those types of returns and you want to be able to focus primarily on what you've done over the course of four weeks or so and that result and that return is your goal you're not trying to get an everyday percentage you're not trying to get an every week percentage you're looking at how you close each

## Section 16 [11:11]

month and this month positive because if it's positive that's better than a loss if you continuously do that you're going in the right direction but try not to rush profits and try not to look beyond the scope of what your monthly return is invite the possibility of being wrong i understand obsessive compulsive disorder we struggle with it and we still struggle with it in our forties but i want you to understand something michael you are not going to be right 100 of the time and early on the first couple years you're spending time

## Section 17 [11:50]

trying to perfect and eliminate the possibility of you being wrong and it's a farce don't do that you're going to waste time doing that there is no perfect person there is no perfect trader and you still with almost three decades of experience i'm speaking to you now you are still not perfect your exits aren't perfect your entries aren't perfect all the time perfection is still going to evade you but you do not need perfection when you're wrong many times that's going to lead to a more profitable trade or identifying that you're wrong and getting out and staying on the sidelines preserves your capital by preserving your capital you don't go into spending

## Section 18 [12:34]

your mental capital and the mental capital is how much money you're really willing to lose you may have twenty thousand dollars in that trading account but you're really not comfortable if you lost five thousand of it so what are you really trading with five thousand dollars but the twenty thousand dollars is just lipstick the extra fifteen thousand is padding that you hope you never go into and as soon as you do everything gets abandoned the trade plan methodology all of that goes out the door risk management trade management all of it tossed out because now you're emotional and you can't act that way

## Section 19 [13:11]

invite the possibility of being wrong identify the characteristics that leads to your trade idea being wrong identify it before you even put the trade on so in other words what negates the idea what makes it most likely to fail if those trades show signatures of that occurring do not hesitate just simply close the trade preserve capital if you do that you will be on a fast track to preserving your mental capacity your willingness to stay studying even though you're not taking trades if you don't do this you're going to find yourself going into the

## Section 20 [13:52]

longest tail spin in terms of pursuing something that is eluding you because you're causing it you're trying to be perfect and it won't exist it won't it won't happen you're not going to be there that will always evade avoid chasing parabolic equity surges i can recall many of the things that we did and there's some of those instances where it worked out in our favor but most of the time it didn't so avoiding parabolic equity surges is one of the things that it's going to be very hard for you because the first one you get with chicago board trade wheat that sets the

## Section 21 [14:40]

stage for you thinking that you can do this every week and it doesn't work that way avoid trying to allow your account to grow exponentially with these parabolic equity surges where you're getting 100 plus returns quickly try not to do that because number one you have to have the right market conditions you have to have everything on point your entry your stop your trade management your exits there are so many things that have to line up for you to deliver with olympic level equity surges on a consistent basis it's not realistic going into this now it's going to eventually get to the point where you can see these things and

## Section 22 [15:28]

predict them but it won't be in the first few years you're going to make the mistake in believing that you're better than you really are far before you really get it on what it is you should be doing as a trader reduce leverage when taking losses now this is something that i can remember we did very poorly when we would take losses you would increase the amount of contracts trying to recapture and get more equity back in the account because we didn't like the way it felt when money was taken out not only did we not like the fact that we were wrong but we didn't like the fact that

## Section 23 [16:08]

we were wrong and we were robbed of equity and we personified that and made it someone or something that we're going to get revenge on and that i can look back and say that that was 90 of the biggest losses in the biggest and longest streaks of losing trades were linked to that very thing if we would have just simply reduced the leverage for instance if we were trading 10 contracts of the standard poor's futures contract and we took a loss of 2 the next trade should be five lots and if we take a loss there next trade should be two lots

## Section 24 [16:57]

and keep reducing until you make fifty percent of the previous loss back then you can go back up one scale in the money management and risk trade management but if you don't do this you're going to have a wild roller coaster equity swings and many accounts being dusted if you don't do this you're not going to build in plateaus in your equity there's going to be a series of winning trades and then what's going to eventually come that you don't like to admit it's going to be a losing trade or two or three

## Section 25 [17:30]

and if you keep risking the same amount your equity drawdown is going to be notable and horrendous if you don't control yourself so you want to reduce the leverage after taking losses because then the inevitable is going to happen you're going to have a series of losses but if you keep risking two percent two percent two percent two percent it's going to have greater impact on the drawdown that you suffer and it's much more work on your part to recapture that be patient will draw down recovery losing still sucks when you get stopped out it's not fun but it's a business transaction

## Section 26 [18:12]

eventually around the late 20s you're gonna see it as just that it still won't feel good and you'll hate that you have them but you'll come to grips with a little bit but be patient with drawdown recovery in other words don't rush to get it back if you have a day trade or two that shows a net loss for the day stop the next trading day it's very easy to start building that back up and don't try to get it back in one trade you have made so many errors i can tell you right now at least three dozen of them and they were all in soybeans those trades ended up being parlayed into huge losses

## Section 27 [18:53]

and two lost accounts you killed two accounts you don't see it yet oh but it's coming you will have blown two futures accounts trading the soybean market because you're trying to get back your losses and you get caught in a couple limit moves and you can't get out of those and you end up suffering and blowing out the account because you are not being patient you're not going to be patient and you suffer the drawdown and the recovery of it is not only timeline basis in other words there's no deadline that you have to meet to get that money back immediate is what you feel like it has to be

## Section 28 [19:43]

but that's the trap that's the trap you have to avoid that michael if you don't listen to me you're going to find yourself chasing loss after loss after loss and you're not going to be thinking clearly you're going to get even more insanely ra enraged okay it's what it's going to become because you think that the brokers on the other side clicking buttons just to get you and i can tell you honestly looking back you were just doing it wrong and doing it wrong a lot and very frequently pursuing something that is very easily accepted take the loss go home for the day

## Section 29 [20:28]

and see what happens tomorrow if you don't do that you're going to dust multiple accounts manage to keep risk below three percent maximum avoid large risk for large wins now when you first start trading you're going to read a couple things in commodity magazine and it's going to inspire you to trade with a little bit larger risk and you're going to pull out your calculator and you're going to be sitting at lunch while at work and you're going to think if i take my account and i risk 8 10 12 per trade i can do this or that in the time of the end of the month if i do that 12 months in a row i'll be

## Section 30 [21:24]

able to buy this or that don't do that avoid large risk you're not going to be consistent in the beginning you think you are because the books that you bought are telling you that it's just simply just do this do that and when the indicator says this that's when you buy and when indicator says this you sell and you're going to find out very quickly that it doesn't work that way it's it's not that easy expect to make velocity your edge after spending almost 28 years doing this i can tell you everyone still thinks that

## Section 31 [22:06]

having a large r multiple okay or risk the reward model is the secret and that's not the secret the secret is velocity doing something over and over and over again that has an expected result that is high in probability and flipping the equity that's velocity you will in your mid-30s discover how you can take the same account balance and while other traders and other methodology may be focusing on trying to get ten to one or more you can do exceptionally well doing one to one two to one because you can use the lower time

## Section 32 [22:54]

frames that you don't appreciate right now but they are the same market with dozens of setups per day but you're not in the position when you first start to start doing those types of trades it's going to be a little bit of time before you understand that but velocity and turning over the equity without risking a lot that beats every race it beats every trading contest it beats every thing period because you're using the rate of turnover in the equity because you're taking more frequency and you're looking at a result that is measurable it's a repeating recurring pattern that forms every single day

## Section 33 [23:43]

multiple times intraday so it's not that you want to take a larger risk to make bigger money you want to take surgical strikes and parlay the account up using velocity it's just a higher frequency trade of a same reoccurring pattern on a lower time frame and while other traders are waiting for their 10 to 121 30 to 1 that money can only make whatever the maximum our multiple is going to be for it but within those long or higher time frame price swings you're going to be in there moving back and forth both directions most of the money being allocated to the

## Section 34 [24:26]

side of the marketplace it's going to move in and still trading counter trend intraday with less than the risk that you're using when you're trading in sync with the market and you will destroy the 10 to 1 21 31 are multiple type trading models it's simple math but you're going to be distracted michael by all these books and all these things they're going to draw your attention away from the simplest of things is it going to go up is it going to go down how far is going to go up how far is it going to go down at what point is it incorrect and i want to be out of the trade now that same criteria just applied to a

## Section 35 [25:07]

one minute or five minute chart you can take that same equity and flip it over and over and over and over again within the span of say a weekly range it takes five candles to form you may have 30 to 40 trades for the course of the week and they're all one minute setups but if each one of those pay out two percent minimum nothing's going to keep up with that consider the negatives of forcing setups your impatience michael in the beginning because the first trade you put on you lose 50 of your equity and your trading options and you didn't fully understand what you were doing and

## Section 36 [25:56]

option trading is not just simply being right on the marketplace you have to beat the time decay as well you'll learn about that later on with some pain but consider the negatives of forcing the setups because you're going to try to force it you're going to have a level that you want to be buying at but you are impatient and you're going to try to buy it ahead of time and that is a problem because you aren't very versed in proper stop placement in the beginning michael you're going to have your stop too tight because you don't want to risk a lot of money but you are risking five percent on the

## Section 37 [26:37]

trade and that's too much you're risking way too much but you're forcing the entry sooner than it should be taken and it is done at a time where you're using the maximum amount of leverage which strangles the trade because you have to have a very short tight stop in a trade that you entered too soon before the level you want to buy it so when you're doing that you're convincing yourself that you're going to be right and ignoring all of the things that you're doing wrong that is inviting failure you have to consider the negatives of it what is

## Section 38 [27:17]

the impact of that number one you're teaching yourself that not following the rules is okay that trading ahead of the level before it's made a touch or a retest to it that that's normal that's something you should be doing when it doesn't fit within the model if you've identified a level and you want to buy at that level why are you buying before the levels hit because you're forcing the trade you're impatient you want to get in because you're afraid that you're going to miss the move it might not hit your level well guess what so what there's going to be tens of thousands of trades

## Section 39 [27:57]

in your career and you're not going to miss the big money maker because of not getting in early getting in early is always always i can tell you now looking back has always been an error always it never works out in our favor so don't do it taking partials is the best thing you will ever do and i'll say it again taking partials is the best thing that you're ever going to do michael the biggest hurdle in your development is being comfortable with holding the trade you're going to struggle with that it's going to cause anxiety you're going to have heart palpitations you're going to have shortness of breath

## Section 40 [28:51]

you're going to feel like you're going to faint a couple times you're going to vomit a couple times because some of the trades that you're in in the s p are huge and this the smallest little tick is making you go nuts wait around for it it happens but taking partials off while the trade is developing number one it feels good to take something off it feels good and it feels like you're doing something because even when you're in a trade that's winning you're gonna find that it is like holding on to a motorcycle at 200 plus miles an hour it's a it's an incredible rush but you also want to ride the end

## Section 41 [29:37]

sometimes quickly and when you get into trade and it's moving in your favor you want to get there quick you want to get there and get you out of the trade and profit because you don't like the discomfort of not knowing if it's going to hit your target so the way you're going to best deal with that and have the ability to hold on to the trade longer into fruition or to get stopped out because that's part of the plan too you have to take something off so if the trade moves 10 points in your favor take 10 points off with something even if it's one contract or one lot

## Section 42 [30:13]

take something off it feels good it's that cookie that reward when it moves a little bit more take something off again and you're going to find by doing that it helps alleviate the pain and uncertainty of holding on to that trade until it gets to your profit objective taking partials reduces risk while paying you're going to worry in the beginning about getting stopped out all the time and you're going to do a lot of acrobatics with your your stop-loss you're going to move it back when you think it's dropping against you or raise it up when it's rising back up towards your stop and you're going to drive yourself crazy

## Section 43 [30:53]

doing that you have to commit to whatever your stop is going to be based on sound money management and risk and once the trade starts moving in your favor take partials off by doing that not only does it fund you as the trader but it also reduces the risk because every time you take something off you're reducing the exposure that your account and your and your mental capital will withstand so you have to constantly manage not only the trade but you have to manage the trader and its expectation your expectation is you put the trade on because you want to be profitable so what's the best thing that you can do as a trader when the trades in profit

## Section 44 [31:34]

take something off don't be fearful and don't allow greed to say oh i have to hold on for everything it's all or nothing because i'm going to tell you michael when you do that the first couple years you're going to be in some trades for instance coffee you're going to be holding onto a coffee trade that's going to move a lot it's going to move a lot and 35 000 turns into an 8 000 loss because you wanted to get your full target you have to listen you have to listen to this if you don't do these things michael you're going to regret it taking partials is the best thing you're ever going to do

## Section 45 [32:15]

and taking partials reduces risk while paying you ignore unprofitable traders advice on risk if someone that you read if someone that you listen to says anything against what's being said to you right here i would put a million dollars on them not being a profitable trader chances are they have no idea what it is to be consistent they probably had hit and miss type results but consistent long-term trading results come by way of funding the positions and funding the trader or as we say it today pay the trader if you don't do those

## Section 46 [33:01]

things there's nothing guaranteeing michael that your trades gonna hit your target there's absolutely nothing guaranteeing that and the volatility in today's world which at the time of this recording we've seen some pretty dramatic volatility and your trades every time you put them on there's no guarantee that you're going to hit your objective so you have to get to the point where you trust yourself and you don't rely on other people's advice about risk because their advice about your risk is free to them there's no exposure and the advice they're giving you probably isn't sound so stick to what i'm telling you here

## Section 47 [33:47]

commit to it and own it your losses are your losses your wins are your wins no one else can take credit for it and you shouldn't try to share credit weather series of consecutive losses taking losses is normal michael it doesn't feel good it sucks but unfortunately there's simply no way around it every trader loses money every trader suffers drawdown professional traders manage how much and they understand they don't know how long it's going to take before it turns the equity around in order to recovery you will lose fortunes expect the pain the faster you can accept this michael and warm up to the idea that

## Section 48 [34:45]

imperfection is normal it's absolutely normal and there's going to be books that you're going to buy it's going to sound like it's the best book in the world you're going to buy courses and it's going to sound like you're going to get riches untold and is going to fall into your account all of that stuff is nonsense you're going to lose money and you're going to have losing streaks and the amount of money if we could total all up and look back it's enormous but it didn't kill you it didn't take you out of the game it did not defeat you it beats you up a couple times pretty bad and your ego is bruised for well

## Section 49 [35:28]

truth be told i still feel a little pain from it but you're going to have to accept the fact that losing streaks do occur now it's been a long time since i had 10 losses in a row but you're gonna have those and there's nothing wrong with it because it helps you number one respect risk because no one is exempt from being wrong i still get it wrong and you're going to get it wrong a lot in the beginning prepare for that multiple losses does not prove it is broken your trading method is not decided in terms of effectiveness if you have a series of

## Section 50 [36:10]

losing trades a series of losing trades is something that every trading methodology will eventually will eventually plague every methodology there's there is not one single trader that has not endured this it's a normal thing but when you experience it and you have to endure it it feels like it's only you right michael but it's not just you truth is everyone has it but the problem is the people online and the people you read about in their books are not really honest with you they're going to tell you nothing about their losses they're not going to say anything about losing money they're only

## Section 51 [36:47]

going to focus on the sweet sugary coded chapters of their books that says this is what i got rich with and you can too stick to the method and risk reduction when you have your first string of losses michael you're going to want to skip around and try something new and that's the reason why you bought all those books because you were looking for the holy grail and the problem with that is every time you went to a new system it starts off with modest wins and you fall in love with it and you think you figured it out and then it goes into a tailspin and you do things the same way that i've outlined in our discussion here

## Section 52 [37:25]

and you lose track of what you're doing and lose control of yourself and you enter into a series of losing trades your first impulse is to abandon that method and go to something else and the problem with that is is you do this dozens of times now if i could grab you by the lapels and shake you again it's simply this stop bouncing around focus with one thing in mind work with a higher time frame bias work off of one key level work off with one market and stay on one side of the marketplace until proven obviously that you're on the wrong side if you manage your risk don't force the trades and you're patient that alone

## Section 53 [38:10]

can be profitable but you have to stick with the method and if you don't reduce the risk when you take losses you won't have the ability to stay with the method the method eventually it takes six years for you to figure it out by the way six years you figure out exactly who you are as a traitor and it feels like a lifetime it feels like you're never gonna get it michael i know i know how it feels and i wish i could go back and just tell you to your face suck it up just take it because everything changes in your sixth year everything changes it becomes easier it becomes far less stressful to put the

## Section 54 [38:57]

trade on you know exactly what you're looking for you know where your stop should be you had to manage to stop you're not over leveraging your account you're not forcing trades you grow into yourself in the sixth year but prior to that sixth year you're like a wild cowboy and just gunsling and you're not fearful of anything you take on risk that's much larger than you should you trade more times than you should and when you have severe draw down it doesn't bother you and that's a problem you weren't afraid to do anything and you weren't afraid to get into the marketplace with huge

## Section 55 [39:34]

leverage where one trade could wipe out the account that's nonsense and you don't need to do that to do well but you have to stick to a method that's very consistent that will have losses and you manage your risk you will be correct more than you're incorrect it doesn't feel like it now michael but you will be and the only way that happens is sticking to the method sticking to the method working from the macro down to the micro and being willing to admit that you're wrong and either taking the loss and going

## Section 56 [40:15]

home for the day or changing direction and in the beginning it's best if you just take my advice right now michael and just get out of the marketplace and try not to do the reversal because we lose a lot of money doing that too don't look for others to measure against you're going to look at other people other traders other authors and you're going to try to say that you want to be like them and everyone else should not be a measuring stick to you because to have that stunt your growth you're saying that that person's accomplishments and accolades you want them

## Section 57 [41:01]

why focus on the ones that you're going to do yourself the ones that you are going to achieve those successes and those failures because they're stories that are going to be significant and meaningful to you and should anyone sit down with you that has any interest in the marketplace they're gonna be very interested to hear what you have to say you have so many adventures ahead of you michael but so much of the pain that we endure was 120 avoidable so hopefully you've taken my advice here and are going to work towards trying to eliminate some of the pain that we endure

## Section 58 [41:48]

i can tell you as an older man i'd greatly appreciate it if you would and those of you that were listening i hope this was also very beneficial and profitable for your learning and development until next time i wish you good luck and good trading
